meanings.definition: Make a loud noise like a horn.
meanings.sent1: The car honked loudly as it drove by.
meanings.sent2: I honked the horn to alert the pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The goose honked at the other animals in the farm.
meanings.sent4: The honking of the geese filled the air with sound.
meanings.sent5: The honking sound echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To sound a horn or make a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: She honked the bicycle bell to warn the people ahead.
meanings.sent2: The truck driver honked to signal the start of the race.
meanings.sent3: The clown honked his nose to entertain the children.
meanings.sent4: The ship honked its horn before departing the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The honking noise broke the silence of the night.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a horn or similar instrument.
meanings.sent1: The loud honk of the horn startled the dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard a honk coming from the traffic outside.
meanings.sent3: The honk of the trumpet signaled the start of the performance.
meanings.sent4: The honk of the saxophone added a jazzy touch to the song.
meanings.sent5: The honk of the car horn cut through the busy street noise.
